intro: Oldenlandia esquirolii, commonly known as the "Cape of Good Hope flower," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It has thin, wiry stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Oldenlandia esquirolii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
